title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement LinkedIn handle via message. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Welcome clintrialx vignette! package simplifies process fetching analyzing clinical trial data. guide, ’ll demonstrate use clintrialx alongside popular R packages examine visualize clinical trial data specifically cancer studies India. 🚀

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: start, load necessary libraries. use suppressPackageStartupMessages keep output clean:
code: # Load required libraries invisible(suppressPackageStartupMessages({   library(clintrialx)  # For fetching clinical trial data   library(ggplot2)     # For data visualization   library(plotly)      # For interactive plots   library(dplyr)       # For data manipulation   library(lubridate)   # For date handling }))

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Retrieve clinical trial data related cancer studies India using ctg_bulk_fetch function:
code: # Fetch cancer study data in India df <- ctg_bulk_fetch(condition = "cancer", location = "India")

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Understand distribution study statuses creating bar plot: plot provides overview number studies status category. 📉
code: # Create a table of study statuses status_counts <- table(df$`Study Status`)  # Convert the table to a data frame status_df <- data.frame(status = names(status_counts), count = as.numeric(status_counts))  # Generate the bar plot ggplotly(ggplot(status_df, aes(x = reorder(status, -count), y = count)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "orange") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Distribution of Study Statuses",        x = "Study Status",        y = "Count") +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +   geom_text(aes(label = count), vjust = -0.5))

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Compare enrollment numbers across different study phases using interactive box plot: interactive plot allows explore enrollment numbers across different phases identify trends. 🔍
code: # Create an interactive box plot of enrollment by study phase ggplotly(ggplot(df, aes(x = Phases, y = Enrollment)) +   geom_boxplot(fill = "lightblue", outlier.colour = "red", outlier.shape = 1) +   geom_jitter(color = "darkblue", size = 0.5, alpha = 0.5, width = 0.2) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +   labs(title = "Enrollment by Study Phase",        x = "Study Phase",        y = "Enrollment") +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, size = 12),         plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))) ## Warning: Removed 13 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range ## (`stat_boxplot()`).

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Examine timeline studies scatter plot:  scatter plot helps visualize study durations statuses, providing insights timelines. ⏳
code: # Convert date strings to Date objects df$start_date <- as.Date(df$`Start Date`, format = "%Y-%m-%d") df$completion_date <- as.Date(df$`Completion Date`, format = "%Y-%m-%d")  # Create a scatter plot with a horizontal line at 2024 ggplot(df, aes(x = start_date, y = completion_date, color = `Study Status`)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.6) +   geom_hline(yintercept = as.Date("2024-01-01"), linetype = "dashed", color = "blue") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Study Duration Timeline",        x = "Start Date",        y = "Completion Date") +   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") ## Warning in RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n, pal): n too large, allowed maximum for palette Set1 is 9 ## Returning the palette you asked for with that many colors ## Warning: Removed 509 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range ## (`geom_point()`).

what: Analyzing Funding Sources and Study Types
title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Examine relationship funding sources study types using stacked bar plot: plot uncovers patterns different funders support various study types. 💡
code: # Summarize and plot funding sources by study type df_summary <- df %>%   count(`Funder Type`, `Study Type`) %>%   group_by(`Funder Type`) %>%   mutate(prop = n / sum(n))  ggplotly(ggplot(df_summary, aes(x = `Funder Type`, y = prop, fill = `Study Type`)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Funding Sources and Study Types",        x = "Funder Type",        y = "Proportion") +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)))

title: Exploring Clinical Trial Data with `clintrialx`
text: Using clintrialx package along visualization tools like ggplot2 plotly, can extract valuable insights clinical trial data. vignette illustrated techniques analyzing cancer clinical trials India, methods adaptable datasets fetched clintrialx. Happy analyzing! 😊

title: Authors and Citation
text: Indraneel Chakraborty. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chakraborty (2024). clintrialx: Connect work clinical trials sources R programming.. R package version 0.1.0, http://ineelhere.github.io/clintrialx/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {clintrialx: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.},   author = {Indraneel Chakraborty},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {http://ineelhere.github.io/clintrialx/}, }

what: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: goal clintrialx fetch clinical trials data freely available registries. Currently, supports querying ClinicalTrials.gov registry using V2 API CTTI AACT (Public Access Aggregate Content ClinicalTrials.gov).

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: can install package GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ineelhere/clintrialx")

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
code: library(clintrialx)

what: Only if you wish to use AACT as a source for the data
title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: Visit https://aact.ctti-clinicaltrials.org/users/sign_up Sign create account. ’s free. username password needed fetch data using package. Save .Renviron file, example- Now file created, load variable command readRenviron("path//.Renviron) ’re set!
code: user =  "random_name" password = "random_password"

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: Fetch one multiple trial records based NCT IDs. can opt fetch specific fields fields available source (default).
code: library(clintrialx) ctg_get_nct(c("NCT02967965", "NCT04000165", "NCT01007279", "NCT02376244", "NCT01179776"),                           fields = c("NCT Number", "Study Title", "Study Status", "Sponsor"))

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: Supports filtering condition, location, title keywords, intervention, overall status.
code: ctg_get_fields(      condition = "Cancer",      location = "Kolkata",      title = NULL,      intervention = "Drug",      status = c("ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING", "RECRUITING"),      page_size = 10 )

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: Download available data query. limits! Supports filtering condition, location, title keywords, intervention, overall status.
code: df <- ctg_bulk_fetch(location="india")

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
code: # Set environment variables for database credentials in .Renviron and load it # readRenviron(".Renviron")  # Connect to the database con <- aact_connection(Sys.getenv('user'), Sys.getenv('password'))  # Run a custom query query <- "SELECT nct_id, source, enrollment, overall_status FROM studies LIMIT 5;" results <- aact_custom_query(con, query)  # Print the results print(results)

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: can fetch version information directly package:
code: version_info(source = "clinicaltrials.gov")

title: Connect and work with clinical trials sources with R programming.
text: 🚀 Ready contribute? Lets makeclintrialx even better. Check contributing guidelines get started. 💬 Questions Feedback? Feel free open issue GitHub Issues page. 🌟 Enjoying clintrialx? Please consider giving star GitHub! support helps project grow improve. updates come. Happy coding! 🎉

code: # Set environment variables for database credentials in .Renviron and load it # readRenviron(".Renviron")  # Connect to the database con <- aact_connection(Sys.getenv('user'), Sys.getenv('password')) #> Error in postgresqlNewConnection(drv, ...): RPosgreSQL error: could not connect runner@aact-db.ctti-clinicaltrials.org:5432 on dbname "aact": connection to server at "aact-db.ctti-clinicaltrials.org" (174.138.61.222), port 5432 failed: fe_sendauth: no password supplied  # Run a custom query query <- "SELECT nct_id, source, enrollment, overall_status FROM studies LIMIT 5;" results <- aact_custom_query(con, query) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'conn' in selecting a method for function 'dbGetQuery': object 'con' not found  # Print the results print(results) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'results' not found

what: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
title: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
text: function retrieves clinical trial data bulk ClinicalTrials.gov API based specified parameters. handles pagination returns combined dataset.

title: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
code: ctg_bulk_fetch(   condition = NULL,   location = NULL,   title = NULL,   intervention = NULL,   status = NULL )

title: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
text: condition Character string specifying condition search . location Character string specifying location search . title Character string specifying title search . intervention Character string specifying intervention search . status character vector specifying recruitment status trials. Allowed values : Valid values include: ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING - Studies actively conducting         recruiting participants. COMPLETED - Studies completed phases. ENROLLING_BY_INVITATION - Studies enrolling participants         invitation . NOT_YET_RECRUITING - Studies yet started recruiting. RECRUITING - Studies actively recruiting participants. SUSPENDED - Studies temporarily halted. TERMINATED - Studies terminated completion. WITHDRAWN - Studies withdrawn enrollment. AVAILABLE - Studies available. NO_LONGER_AVAILABLE - Studies longer available. TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE - Studies temporarily available. APPROVED_FOR_MARKETING - Studies approved marketing. WITHHELD - Studies data withheld. UNKNOWN - Studies unknown status.

title: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
text: data frame containing fetched clinical trial data.

title: Bulk Fetch Clinical Trial Data from ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_bulk_fetch
code: trials <- ctg_bulk_fetch(location="india")

what: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
title: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
text: function retrieves count clinical trials ClinicalTrials.gov based specified parameters.

title: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
code: ctg_count(   condition = NULL,   location = NULL,   title = NULL,   intervention = NULL,   status = NULL )

title: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
text: condition character string specifying condition studied (default: NULL). location character string specifying location trials (default: NULL). title character string specifying keywords study title (default: NULL). intervention character string specifying type intervention (default: NULL). status character vector specifying recruitment status trials. Allowed values :               Valid values include: ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING - Studies actively conducting                       recruiting participants. COMPLETED - Studies completed phases. ENROLLING_BY_INVITATION - Studies enrolling participants                       invitation . NOT_YET_RECRUITING - Studies yet started recruiting. RECRUITING - Studies actively recruiting participants. SUSPENDED - Studies temporarily halted. TERMINATED - Studies terminated completion. WITHDRAWN - Studies withdrawn enrollment. AVAILABLE - Studies available. NO_LONGER_AVAILABLE - Studies longer available. TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE - Studies temporarily available. APPROVED_FOR_MARKETING - Studies approved marketing. WITHHELD - Studies data withheld. UNKNOWN - Studies unknown status. Default NULL.

title: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
text: number representing total count clinical trials matching specified parameters.

title: Get Count of Clinical Trials from ClinicalTrials.gov — ctg_count
code: ctg_count(   condition = "Cancer",   location = "India",   title = NULL,   intervention = "Drug",   status = "RECRUITING" ) #> [1] 101

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
text: function sends query ClinicalTrials.gov API returns results tibble. Users can specify various parameters filter results, parameter provided, omitted query.

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
code: ctg_get_fields(   condition = NULL,   location = NULL,   title = NULL,   intervention = NULL,   status = NULL,   page_size = 20 )

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
text: condition character string specifying medical condition search . filter results studies related given condition. location character string specifying location (e.g., city country) search . filter results studies conducted specified location. title character string specifying keywords search study title. filter results studies title include specified keywords. intervention character string specifying intervention treatment search . filter results studies involving specified intervention. status character vector specifying overall status studies. Valid values include: ACTIVE_NOT_RECRUITING - Studies actively conducting         recruiting participants. COMPLETED - Studies completed phases. ENROLLING_BY_INVITATION - Studies enrolling participants         invitation . NOT_YET_RECRUITING - Studies yet started recruiting. RECRUITING - Studies actively recruiting participants. SUSPENDED - Studies temporarily halted. TERMINATED - Studies terminated completion. WITHDRAWN - Studies withdrawn enrollment. AVAILABLE - Studies available. NO_LONGER_AVAILABLE - Studies longer available. TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE - Studies temporarily available. APPROVED_FOR_MARKETING - Studies approved marketing. WITHHELD - Studies data withheld. UNKNOWN - Studies unknown status. page_size integer specifying number results per page. default value 20. maximum allowed value 1,000. value greater 1,000 specified, coerced 1,000. specified, default value used.

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
text: tibble containing query results. row represents study, columns         correspond study details returned API.

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
text: function can return 1,000 results. function constructs query ClinicalTrials.gov API using provided parameters. supports filtering condition, location, title keywords, intervention, overall status. function handles API response, checks errors, parses results tibble.

title: Query ClinicalTrials.gov API — ctg_get_fields
code: # Query for studies related to "diabetes" in "Kolkata" with the status "RECRUITING" ctg_get_fields(condition = "diabetes", location = "Kolkata",                                  status = "RECRUITING") #> The Query matches 8 trial records in the ClinicalTrials.gov records. #> Your query returned 8 trial records. #> # A tibble: 8 × 30 #>   `NCT Number` `Study Title`  `Study URL` Acronym `Study Status` `Brief Summary` #>   <chr>        <chr>          <chr>       <chr>   <chr>          <chr>           #> 1 NCT05929066  A Study of Re… https://cl… TRIUMP… RECRUITING     "The purpose o… #> 2 NCT06065540  A Research St… https://cl… REIMAG… RECRUITING     "The study wil… #> 3 NCT06221969  A Research St… https://cl… NA      RECRUITING     "This study wi… #> 4 NCT05929079  A Study of Re… https://cl… TRIUMP… RECRUITING     "The purpose o… #> 5 NCT05254002  A Study to Le… https://cl… CONFID… RECRUITING     "Finerenone wo… #> 6 NCT04596631  A Research St… https://cl… PIONEE… RECRUITING     "This study co… #> 7 NCT06370715  A Study of LY… https://cl… NA      RECRUITING     "The purpose o… #> 8 NCT06269107  A Research St… https://cl… COMBIN… RECRUITING     "This study wi… #> # ℹ 24 more variables: `Study Results` <chr>, Conditions <chr>, #> #   Interventions <chr>, `Primary Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   `Secondary Outcome Measures` <chr>, `Other Outcome Measures` <lgl>, #> #   Sponsor <chr>, Collaborators <chr>, Sex <chr>, Age <chr>, Phases <chr>, #> #   Enrollment <dbl>, `Funder Type` <chr>, `Study Type` <chr>, #> #   `Study Design` <chr>, `Other IDs` <chr>, `Start Date` <date>, #> #   `Primary Completion Date` <chr>, `Completion Date` <chr>, …   # Query for studies with "vaccine" in the title and the status "COMPLETED" ctg_get_fields(title = "vaccine", status = "COMPLETED", page_size = 50) #> The Query matches 5516 trial records in the ClinicalTrials.gov records. #> Your query returned 50 trial records. #> # A tibble: 50 × 30 #>    `NCT Number` `Study Title` `Study URL` Acronym `Study Status` `Brief Summary` #>    <chr>        <chr>         <chr>       <chr>   <chr>          <chr>           #>  1 NCT04707391  Immunogenici… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "The purpose o… #>  2 NCT00561080  Immunogenici… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "Primary objec… #>  3 NCT04319380  Seasonal Mal… https://cl… RTSS-S… COMPLETED      "A double-blin… #>  4 NCT01272180  Safety and I… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "This study wi… #>  5 NCT00861380  Evaluation o… https://cl… FinIP   COMPLETED      "The aim of th… #>  6 NCT00518180  A Study to E… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "This study wi… #>  7 NCT06352580  Covid-19 Pan… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "Coronavirus (… #>  8 NCT02126462  Safety and I… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "Na-GST-1 and … #>  9 NCT00020462  Vaccine Ther… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "RATIONALE: Va… #> 10 NCT00509691  Vaccine Ther… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "RATIONALE: Va… #> # ℹ 40 more rows #> # ℹ 24 more variables: `Study Results` <chr>, Conditions <chr>, #> #   Interventions <chr>, `Primary Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   `Secondary Outcome Measures` <chr>, `Other Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   Sponsor <chr>, Collaborators <chr>, Sex <chr>, Age <chr>, Phases <chr>, #> #   Enrollment <dbl>, `Funder Type` <chr>, `Study Type` <chr>, #> #   `Study Design` <chr>, `Other IDs` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, …

what: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
text: Retrieves data one clinical trials ClinicalTrials.gov API based NCT ID(s).

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
code: ctg_get_nct(nct_ids, fields = NULL)

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
text: nct_ids character vector one NCT IDs (e.g., "NCT04000165") clinical trials fetch. fields character vector specifying fields retrieve. NULL (default), available fields fetched. specified, must subset available fields.

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
text: tibble containing clinical trial data columns matching requested fields.

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
text: function allows specify one NCT IDs optionally select specific fields interest. fetches relevant data returns tibble. function constructs request NCT ID, specifying desired fields. uses progress bar show progress fetching data multiple trials. data returned tibble columns corresponding requested fields. fetches fail API response contains columns requested, warnings issued. Ensure fields parameter contains valid field names specified guide . Invalid fields result error.

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct
text: following available fields can request ClinicalTrials.gov:   NCT Number,   Study Title,   Study URL,   Acronym,   Study Status,   Brief Summary,   Study Results,   Conditions,   Interventions,   Primary Outcome Measures,   Secondary Outcome Measures,   Outcome Measures,   Sponsor,   Collaborators,   Sex,   Age,   Phases,   Enrollment,   Funder Type,   Study Type,   Study Design,   IDs,   Start Date,   Primary Completion Date,   Completion Date,   First Posted,   Results First Posted,   Last Update Posted,   Locations,   Study Documents

title: Fetch Clinical Trial Data Based on NCT ID — ctg_get_nct

ℹ 24 more variables: `Study Results` <chr>, Conditions <chr>, #> #   Interventions <chr>, `Primary Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   `Secondary Outcome Measures` <chr>, `Other Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   Sponsor <chr>, Collaborators <chr>, Sex <chr>, Age <chr>, Phases <chr>, #> #   Enrollment <chr>, `Funder Type` <chr>, `Study Type` <chr>, #> #   `Study Design` <chr>, `Other IDs` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, #> #   `Primary Completion Date` <chr>, `Completion Date` <chr>, …  # Fetch data for multiple NCT IDs multiple_trials <- ctg_get_nct(c("NCT04000165", "NCT04002440")) multiple_trials #> # A tibble: 2 × 30 #>   `NCT Number` `Study Title`  `Study URL` Acronym `Study Status` `Brief Summary` #>   <chr>        <chr>          <chr>       <chr>   <chr>          <chr>           #> 1 NCT04000165  A Dose-Findin… https://cl… NA      COMPLETED      "Background:\n… #> 2 NCT04002440  Directed Use … https://cl… DREAM-… ACTIVE_NOT_RE… "Among ambulat… #> # ℹ 24 more variables: `Study Results` <chr>, Conditions <chr>, #> #   Interventions <chr>, `Primary Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   `Secondary Outcome Measures` <chr>, `Other Outcome Measures` <chr>, #> #   Sponsor <chr>, Collaborators <chr>, Sex <chr>, Age <chr>, Phases <chr>, #> #   Enrollment <chr>, `Funder Type` <chr>, `Study Type` <chr>, #> #   `Study Design` <chr>, `Other IDs` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, #> # title: Print a Welcome Message — hello
text: function prints welcome message ClinTrialX.

title: Print a Welcome Message — hello
code: hello()

title: Print a Welcome Message — hello
text: character string containing welcome message.

title: Print a Welcome Message — hello
code: hello() #> [1] "👋 Welcome to ClinTrialX!"

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
text: function retrieves version information specified clinical trials API sources.

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
code: version_info(source = "clinicaltrials.gov")

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
text: source character string specifying source query. Currently, "clinicaltrials.gov" "aact" supported.

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
text: list containing API version data timestamp clinicaltrials.gov,   NULL aact message printed.

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
text: ClinicalTrials.gov API - https://clinicaltrials.gov/api/v2/version AACT - https://aact.ctti-clinicaltrials.org/release_notes

title: Get API Version Information — version_info
code: version_info() #> API version: 2.0.3 #> Timestamp: 2024-07-31 16:38:31 version_info("clinicaltrials.gov") #> API version: 2.0.3 #> Timestamp: 2024-07-31 16:38:31 version_info("aact") #> Please refer to: https://aact.ctti-clinicaltrials.org/api/v2/version
